History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has experienced challenges in communication during travel, particularly in Ecuador, which was humbling and difficult for him. He acknowledges that anger can arise from feeling attacked in conflicts, and he has been working on managing his temper and resolving conflicts through communication.
Medical and Psychiatric History: The patient has not been diagnosed with PTSD or depression. He has a brother with a mental handicap, which affects their relationship.
Psychosocial History: The patient has lived in California since childhood and has not returned to Texas. He enjoys the weather and family presence in LA but finds it expensive and has concerns about traffic. He is pursuing a missionary path with plans to move to Ecuador with his wife. He has a close relationship with his immediate family, including his wife and four daughters.
Physiological Observations: The patient reports some difficulty sleeping due to work shifts, but generally finds it manageable. He can get cranky when he does not sleep well.
